sentence: Logistics is the planning, implementation, and control of efficient and effective forward and reverse flows and the ___ of goods.
The goal of logistics is to provide the customer with the right product, at the right time, at the right place, and the right ___ .
Supply chain management also includes the ___ of stakeholders along the supply chain.
The three classical 'R's of logistics are: the right product, at the right time, at the right ___.
___ logistics refers to processes between different companies or locations.
The operational planning level produces ___ executable instructions for processes.
Tactical supply chain management plans resources such as personnel and ___ .
Strategic planning concerns long-term decisions with high ___ requirements.
A classical logistics problem is the ___ problem.
In a supply chain network, material, information, and ___ flow.
The ___ describes a complex, cross-company logistics-related system.
Reverse logistics deals with the return flow of packaging and ___ .
In an OR model, logistics problems are formulated as ___ .
The goal of scheduling is the optimal ___ of jobs to resources.
The Vogel method is used to generate an initial ___ in the transportation problem.
In ERP systems, operational data is usually complete and very ___ .
A graph with nodes and edges typically represents a ___ .
Disposition is a typical task of ___ planning.
A key goal in SCM is to minimize ___ .
Scheduling typically takes place at the ___ level.
